_comment: Keep file encoded with UTF-8 to support chat formatting http://minecraft.gamepedia.com/Formatting_codes
Storage; used to store materials needed for crafting.
gui.multistorage.assembler.slot.craft.in: Craft Output; if materials needed are available click here to craft.
gui.multistorage.assembler.slot.decon.in: Deconstruction; removes applied upgrade (returning container and upgrade), breaks down containers and upgrades to crafting materials. Stack size must be equal or greater to the amount received when crafting.
gui.multistorage.assembler.slot.buffer.i: Output Buffer; used as temporary storage for automation. This must be empty before more can be crafted.
gui.multistorage.assembler.slot.material: Material Choice; defines look and material used.
gui.multistorage.assembler.button.select: Container/Upgrade Selector; cycles between the available craftables.
gui.multistorage.assembler.preview.info: Container/Upgrade Preview; rendering of the final product.
gui.multistorage.queue.slot.head.out.inf: Queue Start; this is the item at the start of the queue
gui.multistorage.queue.slot.head.in.info: Insert Start; items placed here will be inserted into the start of the queue
gui.multistorage.queue.slot.tail.out.inf: Queue End; this is the item at the end of the queue
gui.multistorage.queue.slot.tail.in.info: Insert End; items placed here will be inserted into the end of the queue
gui.multistorage.queue.button.toggle.inf: Toggle; changes the slot shift-clicking inserts into
gui.multistorage.queue.list.inventory.in: Queue; items in this queue, sorted from start to end
